host.title: Host
host.description: The HTTP host of the InfluxDB server

port.title: Port
port.description: The port of the InfluxDB server

probeInterval.title: Probe Interval
probeInterval.description: Time interval to check if connection is still there, in milliseconds

org.title: Organization
org.description: Organization for InfluxDB. An Organization is a workspace for a group of users, all objects stored in Influxdb belong to an organization

precision.title: Precision
precision.description: Defines the precision to use for timestamps for InfluxDB

maxRetryDelay.title: Max Retry Delay
maxRetryDelay.description: Maximum delay between write retries in milliseconds

minRetryDelay.title: Min Retry Delay
minRetryDelay.description: Minimum delay between write retries in milliseconds

retryJitter.title: Retry Jitter
retryJitter.description: Random value of up to Retry Jitter is added when attempting the next retry

maxBufferLines.title: Max Buffer Lines
maxBufferLines.description: Maximum size of the buffer for items that could not be sent in a previous write

maxRetries.title: Max Retries
maxRetries.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt a write

exponentialBase.title: Exponential Base
exponentialBase.description: Exponential base of the Retry Jitter used when computing the next delay

batchSize.title: Batch Size
batchSize.description: Maximum points/line to send in a single batch to InfluxDB

flushInterval.title: Flush Interval
flushInterval.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to keep points in an unflushed batch

connectionStrategy.description: If a connection attempt fails, retries will be performed with increasing delay (waiting time) in between. The following parameters control how these delays behave.

initialDelay.description: Delay (waiting time) of the first connection retry (in milliseconds). For subsequent retries, the delay will be increased according to the parameter incrementFactor which has a default value of 2.

maxDelay.description: Maximum delay (waiting time) to wait until the next retry (in milliseconds). The delay (waiting time) for any subsequent connection retry will not be larger than this value. Must be strictly greater than initialDelay.

incrementFactor.description: The factor used to increment initialDelay up to maxDelay. For example if initialDelay is set to 1000 and maxDelay to 5000 the values for the delay would be 1000, 2000, 4000, 5000.
